headline: GE Aerospace turns to robots and 'Lean' methods to tackle jet engine repair crunch
summary: GE Aerospace technician Suresh Sinnaiyan has spent more than a decade repairing jet‑engine compressor blades by guiding them across a sanding belt with practised precision.  Now, at the aerospace giant's new automation lab in Singapore, he is teaching a robot to do the same job.  The switch is part of GE's push to prepare the next ‌wave of industrial development and ease one of aviation's biggest bottlenecks: overloaded repair shops and scarce parts.

headline: Is It Too Late To Consider General Electric (GE) After Its Breakup-Fueled Share Price Surge?
summary: If you are wondering whether General Electric's current share price still offers value after a strong run in recent years, this article will walk through what the numbers are really saying about the stock. GE shares most recently closed at US$312.89, with returns of 2.1% over the last 7 days, a 4.4% decline over 30 days, a 2.5% decline year to date, and a 51.0% gain over the past year, alongside a very large 3 year and 5 year return profile. Recent price moves have been supported by ongoing...
